{{BLP sources|date=March 2011}} {{Infobox person | name = Liana Liberato | image = LianaLiberatoTIFFSept10.jpg | caption = Liberato at the [[2010 Toronto International Film Festival]] | birthname = Liana Daine Liberato | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1995|8|20}} | birth_place = [[Galveston, Texas]] | website = http://liana.sweetgiggles.net/ }} '''Liana Daine Liberato''' (born August 20, 1995 in [[Galveston, Texas]]) is an American television and film actress. Liana is known for the 2010 film, ''[[Trust (2010 film)|Trust]]''. She starred in the [[Fox Faith]] film ''[[The Last Sin Eater (film)|The Last Sin Eater]]'' and recently appeared in the ''[[House (TV series)|House]]'' episode "[[It's a Wonderful Lie (House)|It's a Wonderful Lie]]". She was featured in the cover story of the June 4, 2006 issue of ''[[The New York Times Magazine]]'' titled "Hollywood Elementary" with her friend [[Hannah Marks]].{{cite web | url=http://www.hannahmarks.com/news/stories/nytimesall.aspx | title=Hollywood Elementary | author=Adrian Nicole LeBlanc | publisher=''[[The New York Times Magazine]]'' | date=2006-06-04 | accessdate=2008-04-29}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} ==Biography== When Liberato was three, her mother enrolled her in [[Broadway Bound (theater)|Broadway Bound]], a [[musical theater]], so that she "wouldn't be afraid in front of people."{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}} Seven years later, she performed in its show ''[[Guys and Dolls (musical)|Guys & Dolls]].'' Her first television role was in an episode of ''[[Cold Case (TV series)|Cold Case]]'', followed shortly by an episode of ''[[CSI: Miami]]'', and then an episode of the short-lived series ''[[The Inside]].'' She was also in a commercial for the [[Stockmann|SeppÃ¤lÃ¤]] clothing chain during that time.{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}} Liberato's first significant role came in "Galveston: The Musical" when she was seven. In the summer of 2005, she attended a week-long acting camp in [[California]], where she attracted the attention of Central Artists. Charmed by Liberato's "great charisma and a very natural delivery," the agent asked Liana to travel to [[Hollywood, Los Angeles, California|Hollywood]]. She soon got roles on ''Cold Case'' and ''CSI: Miami.'' In 2007, Liberato played the lead role of Cadi Forbes in the [[20th Century Fox|Fox]] feature film, ''[[The Last Sin Eater (film)|The Last Sin Eater]].'' She starred alongside [[Louise Fletcher]] and [[Henry Thomas]] in the tale of a 10-year-old girl who discovers a secret sin haunting her community of [[Welsh American|Welsh immigrants]] in 1850s [[Appalachia]].[http://inhousemedia.typepad.com/in_house_medias_newsblog/2006/07/liana_liberato_.html In House Media's NewsBlog: Liana Liberato has lead role in "The Last Sin Eater"] In 2008, Liberato starred as Jane, the daughter of the patient, in the show ''[[House (TV series)|House MD]]'', and appeared in [[Miley Cyrus]]'s music video for "[[7 Things]]" off her album ''[[Breakout (Miley Cyrus album)|Breakout]]''. She has appeared twice as the character Tristen Oswald in the series ''[[Sons of Anarchy]]'', once in 2008 and once in 2009. In 2010 she starred in "[[Trust (2010 film)|Trust]]", where she played Annie Cameron, a 14-year-old girl victimized by an online sexual predator. [[Clive Owen]] and [[Catherine Keener]] played her parents and the film was [[David Schwimmer]]'s second foray into directing.{{cite web | url=http://chicago.broadwayworld.com/article/Lookingglass_Theatre_Company_Presents_TRUST_20100113 | title=Lookingglass Theatre Company Presents TRUST | author=BWW News Desk | date=2010-01-13 | accessdate=2010-03-02}} Liberato won a [[Silver Hugo Award for Best Actress]] for her performance in the film at the 46th [[Chicago International Film Festival]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chicagofilmfestival.com/history/overview.php?festival=ciff_2010|title=2010 â 46th Chicago International Film Festival|accessdate=3 July 2011}} In 2011 she played the daughter of [[Nicolas Cage]] and [[Nicole Kidman]] in ''[[Trespass (2011 film)|Trespass]]''. ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" ! Year !! Film/Show !! Role !!
